trans-unit.source: Publish the web service
trans-unit.target: Publish the web service

trans-unit.source: Access the web service
trans-unit.target: Access the web service

trans-unit.source: For a web service to be useful, users need to be able to send data to it and receive results.
trans-unit.target: For a web service to be useful, users need to be able to send data to it and receive results.

trans-unit.source: The web service is an Azure web service that can receive and return data in one of two ways:
trans-unit.target: The web service is an Azure web service that can receive and return data in one of two ways:

trans-unit.source: **Request/Response** - The user sends a single set of credit data to the service by using an HTTP protocol, and the service responds with a single set of results.
trans-unit.target: **Request/Response** - The user sends a single set of credit data to the service by using an HTTP protocol, and the service responds with a single set of results.

trans-unit.source: **Batch Execution** - The user sends to the service the URL of an Azure blob that contains one or more rows of credit data.
trans-unit.target: **Batch Execution** - The user sends to the service the URL of an Azure blob that contains one or more rows of credit data.

trans-unit.source: The service stores the results in another blob and returns the URL of that container.
trans-unit.target: The service stores the results in another blob and returns the URL of that container.

trans-unit.source: On the **DASHBOARD** tab for the web service, there are two links to information that will help a developer write code to access this service.
trans-unit.target: On the **DASHBOARD** tab for the web service, there are two links to information that will help a developer write code to access this service.

trans-unit.source: Click the **API help page** link on the **REQUEST/RESPONSE** row, and a page opens that contains sample code to use the service's request/response protocol.
trans-unit.target: Click the **API help page** link on the **REQUEST/RESPONSE** row, and a page opens that contains sample code to use the service's request/response protocol.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, the link on the **BATCH EXECUTION** row provides example code for making a batch request to the service.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, the link on the **BATCH EXECUTION** row provides example code for making a batch request to the service.

trans-unit.source: The API help page includes samples for R, C#, and Python programming languages.
trans-unit.target: The API help page includes samples for R, C#, and Python programming languages.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to access and use the web service, see [How to consume an Azure Machine Learning web service that has been published from a Machine Learning experiment](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to access and use the web service, see [How to consume an Azure Machine Learning web service that has been published from a Machine Learning experiment](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).
